questions.question: ……………………. stringent antidrug laws, drug peddlers persist in selling narcotics.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: ……………………….. there are stringent antidrug laws, drug peddlers persist in selling narcotics.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas. It is a conjunction and is followed by a clause.

questions.question: I knew no one at the party ……………………. that did not stop me from having a nice time.
questions.description: But is used to connect two contrasting ideas. Note that although usually goes at the beginning of a clause whereas but usually goes after the first clause.

questions.question: ………………………… my request for support, he did nothing.
questions.description: In spite of is used to connect two contrasting ideas. It is a preposition.

questions.question: I insist that the project ………………………… cancelled
questions.description: Should is not normally used in the clause after insist.

questions.question: I recommend that the highway ……………………… moved to another area.
questions.description: Should is not normally used in the clause after insist.

questions.question: He insisted …………………………. his attorney.
questions.description: Insist is followed by on + ing form.

questions.question: ……………………….. my childhood was peaceful, my adulthood is hectic and stressful.
questions.description: While is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: A huge tree now stands …………………………. I planted a small seed.
We started early ………………………… we wouldn’t get stuck in the traffic.
questions.description: So that and in order that indicate the purpose.

questions.question: ……………………….. his long legs, he is a good runner.
questions.description: Due to is similar to because of.

questions.question: I always try new things ……………………………….. my fears.
